1.judgment_en: The Creative works sublime success, furthering through perseverance.
1.image_zh: 天行健，君子以自強不息。
1.image_en: The movement of heaven is full of power. Thus the superior man makes himself strong and untiring.

lines.line_zh: 初九，潛龍勿用。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Hidden dragon. Do not act.

lines.line_zh: 九二，見龍在田，利見大人。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Dragon appearing in the field. It furthers one to see the great man.

lines.line_zh: 九三，君子終日乾乾，夕惕若，厲無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: All day long the superior man is creatively active. At nightfall his mind is still beset with cares. Danger. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九四，或躍在淵，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Wavering flight over the depths. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九五，飛龍在天，利見大人。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Flying dragon in the heavens. It furthers one to see the great man.

lines.line_zh: 上九，亢龍有悔。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.

2.judgment_zh: 元亨，利牝馬之貞。君子有攸往，先迷後得主，利。西南得朋，東北喪朋。安貞吉。
2.judgment_en: The Receptive brings about sublime success, furthering through the perseverance of a mare. If the superior man undertakes something and tries to lead, he goes astray; but if he follows, he finds guidance. It is favorable to find friends in the west and south, to forego friends in the east and north. Quiet perseverance brings good fortune.
2.image_zh: 地勢坤，君子以厚德載物。
2.image_en: The earth's condition is receptive devotion. Thus the superior man of broad character carries the outer world.

lines.line_zh: 初六，履霜，堅冰至。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: When there is frost underfoot, solid ice is not far off.

lines.line_zh: 六二，直方大，不習無不利。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Straight, square, great. Without purpose, yet nothing remains unfurthered.

lines.line_zh: 六三，含章可貞，或從王事，無成有終。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Hidden lines. One is able to remain persevering. If by chance you are in the service of a king, seek not works, but bring to completion.

lines.line_zh: 六四，括囊，無咎無譽。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: A tied-up sack. No blame, no praise.

lines.line_zh: 六五，黃裳，元吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: A yellow lower garment brings supreme good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，龍戰于野，其血玄黃。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Dragons fight in the meadow. Their blood is black and yellow.

3.judgment_zh: 元亨利貞，勿用有攸往，利建侯。
3.judgment_en: Difficulty at the Beginning works sublime success, furthering through perseverance. Nothing should be undertaken. It furthers one to appoint helpers.
3.image_en: Clouds and thunder: the image of Difficulty at the Beginning. Thus the superior man brings order out of confusion.

lines.line_zh: 初九，磐桓，利居貞，利建侯。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Hesitation and hindrance. It is favorable to remain persevering. It is favorable to appoint helpers.

lines.line_zh: 六二，屯如邅如，乘馬班如，匪寇婚媾。女子貞不字，十年乃字。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Difficulties pile up. Horse and wagon part. He is not a robber; he will woo her in due time. The maiden is steadfast and does not pledge herself. Ten years--then she pledges herself.

lines.line_zh: 六三，即鹿無虞，惟入于林中，君子幾，不如舍，往吝。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Whoever hunts deer without the forester only loses his way in the forest. The superior man understands the signs of the time and prefers to desist. To go on brings humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 六四，乘馬班如，求婚媾，往吉，無不利。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Horse and wagon part. Strive for union. To go brings good fortune. Everything acts to further.

lines.line_zh: 九五，屯其膏，小貞吉，大貞凶。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Difficulties in blessing. Perseverance in small matters brings good fortune. Perseverance in great matters brings misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，乘馬班如，泣血漣如。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Horse and wagon part. Bloody tears flow.

4.judgment_zh: 匪我求童蒙，童蒙求我。初筮告，再三瀆，瀆則不告。利貞。
4.judgment_en: It is not I who seek the young fool; the young fool seeks me. At the first oracle I inform him. If he asks two or three times, it is importunity. If he is importunate, I give him no information. Perseverance furthers.
4.image_zh: 山下出泉，蒙。君子以果行育德。
4.image_en: A spring wells up at the foot of the mountain: the image of Youth. Thus the superior man fosters his character by thoroughness in all that he does.

lines.line_zh: 初六，發蒙，利用刑人，用說桎梏，以往吝。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: To bring development to the fool it is advantageous to use punishments. One should remove the fetters. To go on in this way brings humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 九二，包蒙，吉。納婦，吉。子克家。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: To bear with fools in kindliness brings good fortune. To know how to take women brings good fortune. The son is capable of taking charge of the household.

lines.line_zh: 六三，勿用取女，見金夫，不有躬，無攸利。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Take not this maiden to wife. She sees a man of bronze and is not true to herself. Nothing that is done will be advantageous.

lines.line_zh: 六四，困蒙，吝。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Entangled folly brings humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 六五，童蒙，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Childlike folly brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，擊蒙，不利為寇，利禦寇。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Striking the fool. It does not further one to commit transgressions. It furthers one to ward off transgressions.

5.judgment_zh: 有孚，光亨，貞吉。利涉大川。
5.judgment_en: Waiting. If you are sincere, you have light and success. Perseverance brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.
5.image_zh: 雲上于天，需。君子以飲食宴樂。
5.image_en: Clouds rise up to the heavens: the image of Waiting. Thus the superior man eats and drinks, is joyous and of good cheer.

lines.line_zh: 初九，需于郊，利用恆，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Waiting in the meadow. It furthers one to abide in what is enduring. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，需于沙，小有言，終吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Waiting on the sand. There is some gossip. The end brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，需于泥，致寇至。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: Waiting in the mud brings about the arrival of the enemy.

lines.line_zh: 六四，需于血，出自穴。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Waiting in blood. Get out of the pit.

lines.line_zh: 九五，需于酒食，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Waiting at meat and drink. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，入于穴，有不速之客三人來，敬之終吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: One falls into the pit. Three uninvited guests arrive. Honor them, and in the end there will be good fortune.

6.judgment_zh: 有孚，窒惕，中吉，終凶。利見大人，不利涉大川。
6.judgment_en: Conflict. You are sincere and are being obstructed. A cautious halt in the middle of the way brings good fortune. Going through to the end brings misfortune. It furthers one to see the great man. It does not further one to cross the great water.
6.image_zh: 天與水違行，訟。君子以作事謀始。
6.image_en: Heaven and water go their opposite ways: the image of Conflict. Thus in all his transactions the superior man carefully considers the beginning.

lines.line_zh: 初六，不永所事，小有言，終吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: If one does not perpetuate the affair, there is a little gossip. In the end, good fortune comes.

lines.line_zh: 九二，不克訟，歸而逋，其邑人三百戶，無眚。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: One cannot engage in conflict; one returns home, gives way. The people of his town, three hundred households, remain free of guilt.

lines.line_zh: 六三，食舊德，貞厲，終吉。或從王事，無成。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: To nourish oneself on ancient virtue induces perseverance. Danger. In the end, good fortune comes. If by chance you are in the service of a king, seek not works.

lines.line_zh: 九四，不克訟，復即命，渝安貞，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: One cannot engage in conflict. One turns back and submits to fate, changes one's attitude, and finds peace in perseverance. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，訟，元吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: To contend before the arbitrator brings supreme good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，或錫之鞶帶，終朝三褫之。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Even if by chance a leather belt is bestowed on one, by the end of a morning it will have been snatched away three times.

7.judgment_en: The army. The army needs perseverance and a strong man. Good fortune without blame.
7.image_zh: 地中有水，師。君子以容民畜眾。
7.image_en: In the middle of the earth is water: the image of the Army. Thus the superior man increases his masses by generosity toward the people.

lines.line_zh: 初六，師出以律，否臧凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: An army must set forth in proper order. If the order is not good, misfortune threatens.

lines.line_zh: 九二，在師中，吉，無咎，王三錫命。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: In the midst of the army. Good fortune. No blame. The king has bestowed a triple decoration.

lines.line_zh: 六三，師或輿尸，凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: The army may have to carry corpses in the wagon. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六四，師左次，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: The army camps on the left. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，田有禽，利執言，無咎。長子帥師，弟子輿尸，貞凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: There is game in the field. It is favorable to let the eldest lead the army. The younger transports corpses; then perseverance brings misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，大君有命，開國承家，小人勿用。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: The great prince issues commands, founds states, vests families with fiefs. Inferior people should not be employed.

8.judgment_zh: 吉。原筮，元永貞，無咎。不寧方來，後夫凶。
8.judgment_en: Holding together brings good fortune. Inquire of the oracle once again whether you possess sublimity, constancy, and perseverance; then there is no blame. Those who are uncertain gradually join. Whoever comes too late meets with misfortune.
8.image_zh: 地上有水，比。先王以建萬國，親諸侯。
8.image_en: On the earth is water: the image of Holding Together. Thus the kings of antiquity bestowed the different states as fiefs and cultivated friendly relations with the feudal lords.

lines.line_zh: 初六，有孚比之，無咎。有孚盈缶，終來有他，吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Hold to him in truth and loyalty; this is without blame. Truth, like a full earthen bowl: thus in the end good fortune comes from without.

lines.line_zh: 六二，比之自內，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Hold to him inwardly. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，比之匪人。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: You hold together with the wrong people.

lines.line_zh: 六四，外比之，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Hold to him outwardly also. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，顯比，王用三驅，失前禽，邑人不誡，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Manifestation of holding together. In the hunt the king uses beaters on three sides only and forgoes game that runs off in front. The citizens need no warning. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，比之無首，凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: He finds no head for holding together. Misfortune.

9.name_en: The Taming Power of the Small
9.judgment_en: The Taming Power of the Small has success. Dense clouds, no rain from our western region.
9.image_zh: 風行天上，小畜。君子以懿文德。
9.image_en: The wind drives over the heavens: the image of the Taming Power of the Small. Thus the superior man refines the outward aspect of his nature.

lines.line_zh: 初九，復自道，何其咎，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Return to the way. How could there be blame in this? Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，牽復，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: He allows himself to be drawn into returning. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，輿說輻，夫妻反目。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: The spokes burst out of the wagon wheels. Man and wife roll their eyes at each other.

lines.line_zh: 六四，有孚，血去惕出，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: If you are sincere, blood vanishes and fear gives way. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九五，有孚攣如，富以其鄰。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: If you are sincere and loyally attached, you are rich in your neighbor.

lines.line_zh: 上九，既雨既處，尚德載，婦貞厲。月幾望，君子征凶。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: The rain comes, the resting place is reached; this is due to the lasting effect of character. Perseverance brings the woman into danger. The moon is nearly full. If the superior man persists, misfortune comes.

10.judgment_en: Treading. Treading upon the tail of the tiger. It does not bite the man. Success.
10.image_zh: 上天下澤，履。君子以辨上下，定民志。
10.image_en: Heaven above, the lake below: the image of Treading. Thus the superior man discriminates between high and low, and thereby fortifies the thinking of the people.

lines.line_zh: 初九，素履，往無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Simple conduct. Progress without blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，履道坦坦，幽人貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Treading a smooth, level course. The perseverance of a dark man brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，眇能視，跛能履，履虎尾，咥人，凶。武人為于大君。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: A one-eyed man can see, a lame man can tread. He treads on the tail of the tiger. The tiger bites the man. Misfortune. Thus does a warrior act on behalf of his great prince.

lines.line_zh: 九四，履虎尾，愬愬終吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: He treads on the tail of the tiger. Caution and circumspection lead ultimately to good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，夬履，貞厲。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Resolute conduct. Perseverance with awareness of danger.

lines.line_zh: 上九，視履考祥，其旋元吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Look to your conduct and weigh the favorable signs. When everything is fulfilled, supreme good fortune comes.

11.judgment_en: Peace. The small departs, the great approaches. Good fortune. Success.
11.image_zh: 天地交，泰。后以財成天地之道，輔相天地之宜，以左右民。
11.image_en: Heaven and earth unite: the image of Peace. Thus the ruler fashions and completes the course of heaven and earth, and so gives aid and comfort to the people.

lines.line_zh: 初九，拔茅茹，以其彙，征吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it. Each according to his kind. Undertakings bring good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，包荒，用馮河，不遐遺，朋亡，得尚于中行。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Bearing with the uncultured in magnanimity, crossing the river with energy, not neglecting what is distant, not regarding one's companions: thus one may manage to walk in the middle.

lines.line_zh: 九三，無平不陂，無往不復，艱貞無咎。勿恤其孚，于食有福。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: No plain not followed by a slope. No going not followed by a return. He who remains persevering in danger is without blame. Do not complain about this truth; enjoy the good fortune you still possess.

lines.line_zh: 六四，翩翩不富，以其鄰，不戒以孚。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: He flutters down, not boasting of his wealth, together with his neighbor, guileless and sincere.

lines.line_zh: 六五，帝乙歸妹，以祉元吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: The sovereign I gives his daughter in marriage. This brings blessing and supreme good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，城復于隍，勿用師。自邑告命，貞吝。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: The wall reverts to the moat. Use no army. Announce your commands to your own town. Perseverance brings humiliation.

12.judgment_zh: 否之匪人，不利君子貞，大往小來。
12.judgment_en: Standstill. Evil people do not further the perseverance of the superior man. The great departs; the small approaches.
12.image_zh: 天地不交，否。君子以儉德辟難，不可榮以祿。
12.image_en: Heaven and earth do not unite: the image of Standstill. Thus the superior man falls back upon his inner worth in order to escape the difficulties. He does not permit himself to be honored with revenue.

lines.line_zh: 初六，拔茅茹，以其彙，貞吉亨。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it. Each according to his kind. Perseverance brings good fortune and success.

lines.line_zh: 六二，包承。小人吉，大人否亨。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: They bear and endure; this means good fortune for inferior people. The standstill serves to help the great man to attain success.

lines.line_zh: 六三，包羞。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: They bear shame.

lines.line_zh: 九四，有命無咎，疇離祉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: He who acts at the command of the highest remains without blame. Those of like mind partake of the blessing.

lines.line_zh: 九五，休否，大人吉。其亡其亡，系于苞桑。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Standstill is giving way. Good fortune for the great man. 'What if it should fail, what if it should fail?' In this way he ties it to a cluster of mulberry shoots.

lines.line_zh: 上九，傾否，先否後喜。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: The standstill is overthrown. First standstill, then good fortune.

13.judgment_zh: 同人于野，亨。利涉大川，利君子貞。
13.judgment_en: Fellowship with men in the open. Success. It furthers one to cross the great water. The perseverance of the superior man furthers.
13.image_zh: 天與火，同人。君子以類族辨物。
13.image_en: Heaven together with fire: the image of Fellowship with Men. Thus the superior man organizes the clans and makes distinctions between things.

lines.line_zh: 初九，同人于門，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Fellowship with men at the gate. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，同人于宗，吝。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Fellowship with men in the clan. Humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 九三，伏戎于莽，升其高陵，三歲不興。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: He hides weapons in the thicket; he climbs the high hill in front of it. For three years he does not rise up.

lines.line_zh: 九四，乘其墉，弗克攻，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: He climbs up on his wall; he cannot attack. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，同人，先號啕而後笑。大師克相遇。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Men bound in fellowship first weep and lament, but afterward they laugh. After great struggles they succeed in meeting.

lines.line_zh: 上九，同人于郊，無悔。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Fellowship with men in the meadow. No remorse.

14.judgment_en: Possession in Great Measure. Supreme success.
14.image_zh: 火在天上，大有。君子以遏惡揚善，順天休命。
14.image_en: Fire in heaven above: the image of Possession in Great Measure. Thus the superior man curbs evil and furthers good, and thereby obeys the benevolent will of heaven.

lines.line_zh: 初九，無交害，匪咎，艱則無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: No relationship with what is harmful; there is no blame in this. If one remains conscious of difficulty, one remains without blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，大車以載，有攸往，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: A big wagon for loading. One may undertake something. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九三，公用亨于天子，小人弗克。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: A prince offers it to the Son of Heaven. A petty man cannot do this.

lines.line_zh: 九四，匪其彭，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: He makes a difference between himself and his neighbor. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，厥孚交如，威如，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: He whose truth is accessible, yet dignified, has good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，自天祐之，吉無不利。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: He is blessed by heaven. Good fortune. Nothing that does not further.

15.judgment_en: Modesty creates success. The superior man carries things through.
15.image_zh: 地中有山，謙。君子以裒多益寡，稱物平施。
15.image_en: Within the earth, a mountain: the image of Modesty. Thus the superior man reduces that which is too much, and augments that which is too little. He weighs things and makes them equal.

lines.line_zh: 初六，謙謙君子，用涉大川，吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: A superior man of modesty and humility may cross the great water. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，鳴謙，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Modesty that comes to expression. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，勞謙君子，有終，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: A superior man of modesty and merit carries things to conclusion. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六四，無不利，撝謙。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Nothing that would not permit of modesty in movement.

lines.line_zh: 六五，不富以其鄰，利用侵伐，無不利。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: No boasting of wealth before one's neighbor. It is favorable to attack with force. Nothing that would not further.

lines.line_zh: 上六，鳴謙，利用行師，征邑國。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Modesty that comes to expression. It is favorable to set armies marching to chastise one's own city and one's country.

16.judgment_en: Enthusiasm. It furthers one to install helpers and to set armies marching.
16.image_zh: 雷出地奮，豫。先王以作樂崇德，殷薦之上帝，以配祖考。
16.image_en: Thunder comes resounding out of the earth: the image of Enthusiasm. Thus the ancient kings made music in order to honor merit, and offered it with splendor to the Supreme Deity, inviting their ancestors to be present.

lines.line_zh: 初六，鳴豫，凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Enthusiasm that expresses itself brings misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，介于石，不終日，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Firm as a rock. Not a whole day. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，盱豫，悔。遲有悔。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Enthusiasm that looks upward creates remorse. Hesitation brings remorse.

lines.line_zh: 九四，由豫，大有得。勿疑。朋盍簪。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: The source of enthusiasm. He achieves great things. Doubt not. You gather friends around you as a hair clasp gathers the hair.

lines.line_zh: 六五，貞疾，恆不死。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Persistently ill, and still does not die.

lines.line_zh: 上六，冥豫，成有渝，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Deluded enthusiasm. But if after completion one changes, there is no blame.

17.judgment_en: Following has supreme success. Perseverance furthers. No blame.
17.image_zh: 澤中有雷，隨。君子以嚮晦入宴息。
17.image_en: Thunder in the middle of the lake: the image of Following. Thus the superior man at nightfall goes indoors for rest and recuperation.

lines.line_zh: 初九，官有渝，貞吉。出門交有功。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: The standard is changing. Perseverance brings good fortune. To go out of the door in company produces deeds.

lines.line_zh: 六二，係小子，失丈夫。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: If one clings to the little boy, one loses the strong man.

lines.line_zh: 六三，係丈夫，失小子。隨有求得，利居貞。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: If one clings to the strong man, one loses the little boy. Through following one finds what one seeks. It furthers one to remain persevering.

lines.line_zh: 九四，隨有獲，貞凶。有孚在道，以明，何咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Following creates success. Perseverance brings misfortune. To go one's way with sincerity brings clarity. How could there be blame in this?

lines.line_zh: 九五，孚于嘉，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Sincere in the good. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，拘係之，乃從維之。王用亨于西山。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: He meets with firm allegiance and is still further bound. The king introduces him to the Western Mountain.

18.name_en: Work on What Has Been Spoiled
18.judgment_zh: 元亨，利涉大川。先甲三日，後甲三日。
18.judgment_en: Work on What Has Been Spoiled has supreme success. It furthers one to cross the great water. Before the starting point, three days. After the starting point, three days.
18.image_zh: 山下有風，蠱。君子以振民育德。
18.image_en: The wind blows low on the mountain: the image of Decay. Thus the superior man stirs up the people and strengthens their spirit.

lines.line_zh: 初六，幹父之蠱，有子，考無咎，厲終吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. If there is a son, no blame rests upon the departed father. Danger. In the end good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，幹母之蠱，不可貞。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Setting right what has been spoiled by the mother. One must not be too persevering.

lines.line_zh: 九三，幹父之蠱，小有悔，無大咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. There will be a little remorse. No great blame.

lines.line_zh: 六四，裕父之蠱，往見吝。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Tolerating what has been spoiled by the father. In continuing one sees humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 六五，幹父之蠱，用譽。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. One meets with praise.

lines.line_zh: 上九，不事王侯，高尚其事。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: He does not serve kings and princes, sets himself higher goals.

19.judgment_zh: 元亨利貞。至于八月有凶。
19.judgment_en: Approach has supreme success. Perseverance furthers. When the eighth month comes, there will be misfortune.
19.image_zh: 澤上有地，臨。君子以教思無窮，容保民無疆。
19.image_en: The earth above the lake: the image of Approach. Thus the superior man is inexhaustible in his will to teach, and without limits in his tolerance and protection of the people.

lines.line_zh: 初九，咸臨，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Joint approach. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，咸臨，吉無不利。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Joint approach. Good fortune. Everything furthers.

lines.line_zh: 六三，甘臨，無攸利。既憂之，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Comfortable approach. Nothing that would further. If one becomes concerned about it, no blame.

lines.line_zh: 六四，至臨，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Complete approach. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，知臨，大君之宜，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Wise approach. This is right for a great prince. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，敦臨，吉無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Great-hearted approach. Good fortune. No blame.

20.judgment_en: Contemplation. The ablution has been made, but not yet the offering. Full of trust they look up to him.
20.image_zh: 風行地上，觀。先王以省方觀民設教。
20.image_en: The wind blows over the earth: the image of Contemplation. Thus the kings of old visited the regions of the world, contemplated the people, and gave them instruction.

lines.line_zh: 初六，童觀，小人無咎，君子吝。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Boylike contemplation. For an inferior man, no blame. For a superior man, humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 六二，窺觀，利女貞。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Contemplation through the crack of the door. Furthering for the perseverance of a woman.

lines.line_zh: 六三，觀我生，進退。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Contemplation of my life decides the choice between advance and retreat.

lines.line_zh: 六四，觀國之光，利用賓于王。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Contemplation of the light of the kingdom. It furthers one to exert influence as the guest of a king.

lines.line_zh: 九五，觀我生，君子無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Contemplation of my life. The superior man is without blame.

lines.line_zh: 上九，觀其生，君子無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Contemplation of his character. The superior man is without blame.

21.judgment_en: Biting Through has success. It is favorable to let justice be administered.
21.image_zh: 雷電，噬嗑。先王以明罰敕法。
21.image_en: Thunder and lightning: the image of Biting Through. Thus the kings of old made firm the laws through clearly defined penalties.

lines.line_zh: 初九，屨校滅趾，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: His feet are fastened in the stocks, so that his toes disappear. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，噬膚滅鼻，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Bites through tender meat, so that his nose disappears. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六三，噬臘肉，遇毒。小吝，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Bites on old dried meat and strikes on something poisonous. Slight humiliation. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九四，噬乾胏，得金矢。利艱貞，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Bites on dried gristly meat. Receives metal arrows. It furthers one to be mindful of difficulties and to be persevering. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六五，噬乾肉，得黃金。貞厲，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Bites on dried lean meat. Receives yellow gold. Perseveringly aware of danger. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 上九，何校滅耳，凶。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: His neck is fastened in the wooden cangue, so that his ears disappear. Misfortune.

22.judgment_en: Grace has success. In small matters it is favorable to undertake something.
22.image_zh: 山下有火，賁。君子以明庶政，無敢折獄。
22.image_en: Fire at the foot of the mountain: the image of Grace. Thus does the superior man proceed when clearing up current affairs. But he dare not decide controversial issues in this way.

lines.line_zh: 初九，賁其趾，舍車而徒。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: He lends grace to his toes, leaves the carriage, and walks.

lines.line_zh: 六二，賁其須。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Lends grace to the beard on his chin.

lines.line_zh: 九三，賁如濡如，永貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: Graceful and moist. Eternal perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六四，賁如皤如，白馬翰如，匪寇婚媾。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Grace or simplicity? A white horse comes as if on wings. He is not a robber, he will woo in due time.

lines.line_zh: 六五，賁于丘園，束帛戔戔，吝，終吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Grace in the hills and gardens. The roll of silk is meager and small. Humiliation, but in the end good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，白賁，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Simple grace. No blame.

23.judgment_en: Splitting Apart. It does not further one to go anywhere.
23.image_zh: 山附于地，剝。上以厚下安宅。
23.image_en: The mountain rests on the earth: the image of Splitting Apart. Thus those above can ensure their position only by giving generously to those below.

lines.line_zh: 初六，剝床以足，蔑貞凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: The leg of the bed is split. Those who persevere are destroyed. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，剝床以辨，蔑貞凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: The bed is split at the edge. Those who persevere are destroyed. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，剝之，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: He splits with them. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六四，剝床以膚，凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: The bed is split up to the skin. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六五，貫魚，以宮人寵，無不利。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: A shoal of fishes. Favor comes through the court ladies. Everything acts to further.

lines.line_zh: 上九，碩果不食，君子得輿，小人剝廬。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: There is a large fruit still uneaten. The superior man receives a carriage. The house of the inferior man is split apart.

24.judgment_zh: 亨。出入無疾，朋來無咎。反復其道，七日來復，利有攸往。
24.judgment_en: Return. Success. Going out and coming in without error. Friends come without blame. To and fro goes the way. On the seventh day comes return. It furthers one to have somewhere to go.
24.image_zh: 雷在地中，復。先王以至日閉關，商旅不行，后不省方。
24.image_en: Thunder within the earth: the image of the Turning Point. Thus the ancient kings closed the passes at the time of solstice. Merchants and strangers did not go about, and the ruler did not travel through the provinces.

lines.line_zh: 初九，不遠復，無祇悔，元吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Return from a short distance. No need for remorse. Great good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，休復，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Quiet return. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，頻復，厲無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Repeated return. Danger. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六四，中行獨復。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Walking in the midst of others, one returns alone.

lines.line_zh: 六五，敦復，無悔。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Noble-hearted return. No remorse.

lines.line_zh: 上六，迷復，凶，有災眚。用行師，終有大敗，以其國君凶，至于十年不克征。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Missing the return. Misfortune. Misfortune from within and without. If armies are set marching in this way, one will in the end suffer a great defeat, disastrous for the ruler of the country. For ten years it will not be possible to attack again.

25.judgment_zh: 元亨利貞。其匪正有眚，不利有攸往。
25.judgment_en: Innocence. Supreme success. Perseverance furthers. If someone is not as he should be, he has misfortune, and it does not further him to undertake anything.
25.image_zh: 天下雷行，物與無妄。先王以茂對時育萬物。
25.image_en: Under heaven thunder rolls: All things attain the state of innocence. Thus the ancient kings, rich in virtue and in harmony with the time, fostered and nourished all beings.

lines.line_zh: 初九，無妄，往吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Innocent behavior brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，不耕穫，不菑畬，則利有攸往。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: He does not count on the harvest while plowing, nor on the use of the ground while clearing it. It furthers him to undertake something.

lines.line_zh: 六三，無妄之災，或繫之牛，行人之得，邑人之災。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Undeserved misfortune. The cow that was tethered by someone is the wanderer's gain, the citizen's loss.

lines.line_zh: 九四，可貞，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: He who can be persevering remains without blame.

lines.line_zh: 九五，無妄之疾，勿藥有喜。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Use no medicine in an illness incurred through no fault of your own. It will pass of itself.

lines.line_zh: 上九，無妄，行有眚，無攸利。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Innocent action brings misfortune. Nothing furthers.

26.name_en: The Taming Power of the Great
26.judgment_zh: 利貞，不家食吉，利涉大川。
26.judgment_en: The Taming Power of the Great. Perseverance furthers. Not eating at home brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.
26.image_zh: 天在山中，大畜。君子以多識前言往行，以畜其德。
26.image_en: Heaven within the mountain: the image of The Taming Power of the Great. Thus the superior man acquaints himself with many sayings of antiquity and many deeds of the past, in order to strengthen his character thereby.

lines.line_zh: 初九，有厲，利已。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Danger is at hand. It furthers one to desist.

lines.line_zh: 九二，輿說輹。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: The axles of the wagon are removed.

lines.line_zh: 九三，良馬逐，利艱貞。日閑輿衛，利有攸往。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: A good horse that follows others. Awareness of danger, with perseverance, furthers. Practice chariot driving and armed defense daily. It furthers one to have somewhere to go.

lines.line_zh: 六四，童牛之牿，元吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: The headboard of a young bull. Great good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六五，豶豕之牙，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: The tusk of a gelded boar. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，何天之衢，亨。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: One attains the way of heaven. Success.

27.name_en: The Corners of the Mouth (Providing Nourishment)
27.judgment_en: The Corners of the Mouth. Perseverance brings good fortune. Pay heed to the providing of nourishment and to what a man seeks to fill his own mouth with.
27.image_zh: 山下有雷，頤。君子以慎言語，節飲食。
27.image_en: At the foot of the mountain, thunder: the image of Providing Nourishment. Thus the superior man is careful of his words and temperate in eating and drinking.

lines.line_zh: 初九，舍爾靈龜，觀我朵頤，凶。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: You let your magic tortoise go, and look at me with the corners of your mouth drooping. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，顛頤，拂經，于丘頤，征凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Turning to the summit for nourishment, deviating from the path to seek nourishment from the hill. Continuing to do this brings misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，拂頤，貞凶，十年勿用，無攸利。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Turning away from nourishment. Perseverance brings misfortune. For ten years do not act in this way. Nothing furthers.

lines.line_zh: 六四，顛頤，吉。虎視眈眈，其欲逐逐，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Turning to the summit for provision of nourishment brings good fortune. Spying about with sharp eyes like a tiger with an insatiable appetite. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，拂經，居貞吉，不可涉大川。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Turning away from the path. To remain persevering brings good fortune. One should not cross the great water.

lines.line_zh: 上九，由頤，厲吉，利涉大川。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: The source of nourishment. Awareness of danger brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.

28.judgment_en: Preponderance of the Great. The ridgepole sags to the breaking point. It furthers one to have somewhere to go. Success.
28.image_zh: 澤滅木，大過。君子以獨立不懼，遯世無悶。
28.image_en: The lake rises above the trees: the image of Preponderance of the Great. Thus the superior man, when he stands alone, is unconcerned, and if he has to renounce the world, he is undaunted.

lines.line_zh: 初六，藉用白茅，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: To spread white rushes underneath. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，枯楊生稊，老夫得其女妻，無不利。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: A dry poplar sprouts at the root. An older man takes a young wife. Everything furthers.

lines.line_zh: 九三，棟橈，凶。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: The ridgepole sags to the breaking point. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，棟隆，吉。有它吝。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: The ridgepole is braced. Good fortune. If there are ulterior motives, it is humiliating.

lines.line_zh: 九五，枯楊生華，老婦得其士夫，無咎無譽。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: A withered poplar puts forth flowers. An older woman takes a husband. No blame. No praise.

lines.line_zh: 上六，過涉滅頂，凶，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: One must go through the water. It goes over one's head. Misfortune. No blame.

29.judgment_zh: 習坎，有孚，維心亨，行有尚。
29.judgment_en: The Abysmal repeated. If you are sincere, you have success in your heart, and whatever you do succeeds.
29.image_zh: 水洊至，習坎。君子以常德行，習教事。
29.image_en: Water flows on uninterruptedly and reaches its goal: the image of the Abysmal repeated. Thus the superior man walks in lasting virtue and carries on the business of teaching.

lines.line_zh: 初六，習坎，入于坎窞，凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Repetition of the Abysmal. In the abyss one falls into a pit. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，坎有險，求小得。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: The abyss is dangerous. One should strive to attain small things only.

lines.line_zh: 六三，來之坎坎，險且枕，入于坎窞，勿用。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Forward and backward, abyss on abyss. In danger like this, pause at first and wait, otherwise you will fall into a pit in the abyss. Do not act in this way.

lines.line_zh: 六四，樽酒簋貳，用缶，納約自牖，終無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: A jug of wine, a bowl of rice with it; earthen vessels simply handed in through the window. There is certainly no blame in this.

lines.line_zh: 九五，坎不盈，祇既平，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: The abyss is not filled to overflowing, it is filled only to the rim. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 上六，係用徽纆，寘于叢棘，三歲不得，凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Bound with cords and ropes, shut in between thorn-hedged prison walls: for three years one does not find the way. Misfortune.

30.judgment_en: The Clinging. Perseverance furthers. It brings success. Care of the cow brings good fortune.
30.image_zh: 明兩作，離。大人以繼明照于四方。
30.image_en: That which is bright rises twice: the image of Fire. Thus the great man, by perpetuating this brightness, illumines the four quarters of the world.

lines.line_zh: 初九，履錯然，敬之，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: The footprints run crisscross. If one is seriously intent, no blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，黃離，元吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Yellow light. Supreme good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，日昃之離，不鼓缶而歌，則大耋之嗟，凶。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: In the light of the setting sun, men either beat the pot and sing or loudly bewail the approach of old age. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，突如其來如，焚如，死如，棄如。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Its coming is sudden; it flames up, dies down, is thrown away.

lines.line_zh: 六五，出涕沱若，戚嗟若，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Tears in floods, sighing and lamenting. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，王用出征，有嘉折首，獲匪其醜，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: The king uses him to march forth and chastise. Then it is best to kill the leaders and take captive the followers. No blame.

31.judgment_en: Influence. Success. Perseverance furthers. To take a maiden to wife brings good fortune.
31.image_zh: 山上有澤，咸。君子以虛受人。
31.image_en: A lake on the mountain: the image of Influence. Thus the superior man encourages people to approach him by his readiness to receive them.

lines.line_zh: 初六，咸其拇。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: The influence shows itself in the big toe.

lines.line_zh: 六二，咸其腓，凶，居吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: The influence shows itself in the calves of the legs. Misfortune. Tarrying brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，咸其股，執其隨，往吝。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: The influence shows itself in the thighs. Holds to that which follows it. To continue is humiliating.

lines.line_zh: 九四，貞吉悔亡，憧憧往來，朋從爾思。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. If a man is agitated in mind, and his thoughts go hither and thither, only those friends on whom he fixes his conscious thoughts will follow.

lines.line_zh: 九五，咸其脢，無悔。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: The influence shows itself in the back of the neck. No remorse.

lines.line_zh: 上六，咸其輔頰舌。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: The influence shows itself in the jaws, cheeks, and tongue.

32.judgment_en: Duration. Success. No blame. Perseverance furthers. It furthers one to have somewhere to go.
32.image_zh: 雷風，恆。君子以立不易方。
32.image_en: Thunder and wind: the image of Duration. Thus the superior man stands firm and does not change his direction.

lines.line_zh: 初六，浚恆，貞凶，無攸利。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Seeking duration too hastily brings misfortune persistently. Nothing that would further.

lines.line_zh: 九二，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 九三，不恆其德，或承之羞，貞吝。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: He who does not give duration to his character meets with disgrace. Persistent humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 九四，田無禽。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: No game in the field.

lines.line_zh: 六五，恆其德，貞，婦人吉，夫子凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Giving duration to one's character through perseverance. This is good fortune for a woman, misfortune for a man.

lines.line_zh: 上六，振恆，凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Restlessness as an enduring condition brings misfortune.

33.judgment_en: Retreat. Success. In what is small, perseverance furthers.
33.image_zh: 天下有山，遯。君子以遠小人，不惡而嚴。
33.image_en: Mountain under heaven: the image of Retreat. Thus the superior man keeps the inferior man at a distance, not in anger but with dignity.

lines.line_zh: 初六，遯尾，厲，勿用有攸往。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: At the tail in retreat. This is dangerous. One must not wish to undertake anything.

lines.line_zh: 六二，執之用黃牛之革，莫之勝說。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: He holds him fast with yellow oxhide. No one can tear him loose.

lines.line_zh: 九三，係遯，有疾厲，畜臣妾吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: A retreat that is hindered. There is illness and danger. To retain people as men- and maidservants brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，好遯，君子吉，小人否。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Voluntary retreat brings good fortune to the superior man and downfall to the inferior man.

lines.line_zh: 九五，嘉遯，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: Friendly retreat. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，肥遯，無不利。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Cheerful retreat. Everything serves to further.

34.judgment_en: The Power of the Great. Perseverance furthers.
34.image_zh: 雷在天上，大壯。君子以非禮弗履。
34.image_en: Thunder in heaven above: the image of The Power of the Great. Thus the superior man does not tread upon paths that do not accord with established order.

lines.line_zh: 初九，壯于趾，征凶，有孚。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Power in the toes. Continuing brings misfortune. This is certainly true.

lines.line_zh: 九二，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，小人用壯，君子用罔，貞厲。羝羊觸藩，羸其角。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: The inferior man uses power; the superior man does not use it. Perseverance is dangerous. A ram butts against a hedge and gets its horns entangled.

lines.line_zh: 九四，貞吉悔亡，藩決不羸，壯于大輿之輹。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. The hedge opens; there is no entanglement. Power depends upon the axle of a big cart.

lines.line_zh: 六五，喪羊于易，無悔。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Loses the goat with ease. No remorse.

lines.line_zh: 上六，羝羊觸藩，不能退，不能遂，無攸利，艱則吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: A ram butts against a hedge. It cannot go backward, it cannot go forward. Nothing serves to further. If one notes the difficulty, this brings good fortune.

35.judgment_zh: 康侯用錫馬蕃庶，晝日三接。
35.judgment_en: Progress. The powerful prince is honored with horses in large numbers. In a single day he is granted audience three times.
35.image_zh: 明出地上，晉。君子以自昭明德。
35.image_en: The sun rises over the earth: the image of Progress. Thus the superior man himself brightens his bright virtue.

lines.line_zh: 初六，晉如摧如，貞吉。罔孚，裕無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Progressing, but turned back. Perseverance brings good fortune. If one meets with no confidence, one should remain calm. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，晉如愁如，貞吉。受茲介福，于其王母。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Progressing, but in sorrow. Perseverance brings good fortune. Then one receives great happiness from one's ancestress.

lines.line_zh: 六三，眾允，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: All are in accord. Remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 九四，晉如鼫鼠，貞厲。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Progress like a hamster. Perseverance brings danger.

lines.line_zh: 六五，悔亡，失得勿恤，往吉，無不利。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Remorse disappears. Take not gain and loss to heart. Undertakings bring good fortune. Everything serves to further.

lines.line_zh: 上九，晉其角，維用伐邑，厲吉無咎，貞吝。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Making progress with the horns. One is aware of the danger and finds good fortune. No blame. Perseverance brings humiliation.

36.judgment_en: Darkening of the Light. In adversity it furthers one to be persevering.
36.image_zh: 明入地中，明夷。君子以蒞眾，用晦而明。
36.image_en: The light has sunk into the earth: the image of Darkening of the Light. Thus does the superior man live with the great mass: he veils his light, yet still shines.

lines.line_zh: 初九，明夷于飛，垂其翼。君子于行，三日不食。有攸往，主人有言。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Darkening of the light during flight. He lowers his wings. The superior man wanders abroad for three days without eating. He has a place to go. The host has occasion to gossip about him.

lines.line_zh: 六二，明夷，夷于左股，用拯馬壯，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Darkening of the light, injures him in the left thigh. He is saved by a powerful horse. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，明夷于南狩，得其大首，不可疾貞。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: Darkening of the light during the hunt in the south. Their great leader is captured. One must not expect perseverance too soon.

lines.line_zh: 六四，入于左腹，獲明夷之心，于出門庭。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: He penetrates into the left side of the belly. One gets at the very heart of the darkening of the light, and leaves gate and courtyard.

lines.line_zh: 六五，箕子之明夷，利貞。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Darkening of the light of Prince Chi. Perseverance furthers.

lines.line_zh: 上六，不明晦，初登于天，後入于地。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Not light but darkness. First he climbed up to heaven, then he plunged into the depths of the earth.

37.judgment_en: The Family. The perseverance of the woman furthers.
37.image_zh: 風自火出，家人。君子以言有物而行有恆。
37.image_en: Wind comes forth from fire: the image of the Family. Thus the superior man has substance in his words and duration in his way of life.

lines.line_zh: 初九，閑有家，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Firm seclusion within the family. Remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 六二，無攸遂，在中饋，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: She should not follow her whims. She must attend within to the food. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，家人嗃嗃，悔厲吉。婦子嘻嘻，終吝。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: When the family is treated with severity, there is remorse. Danger, but good fortune. When women and children dally and laugh, it leads in the end to humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 六四，富家，大吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: She is the treasure of the house. Great good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，王假有家，勿恤，吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: As a king he approaches his family. Fear not. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，有孚威如，終吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: His work commands respect. In the end good fortune comes.

38.judgment_en: Opposition. In small matters, good fortune.
38.image_zh: 上火下澤，睽。君子以同而異。
38.image_en: Fire above, the lake below: the image of Opposition. Thus the superior man, in the midst of association, preserves his individuality.

lines.line_zh: 初九，悔亡。喪馬，勿逐自復。見惡人，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Remorse disappears. If you lose your horse, do not run after it; it will come back of its own accord. When you see evil people, guard yourself against mistakes.

lines.line_zh: 九二，遇主于巷，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: One meets his master in a narrow street. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六三，見輿曳，其牛掣，其人天且劓，無初有終。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: One sees the wagon dragged back, the oxen halted, a man's hair and nose cut off. Not a good beginning, but a good end.

lines.line_zh: 九四，睽孤，遇元夫，交孚，厲無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Isolated through opposition, one meets a like-minded man with whom one can associate in good faith. Despite the danger, no blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，悔亡，厥宗噬膚，往何咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Remorse disappears. The companion bits his way through the wrappings. If one goes to him, how could it be a mistake?

lines.line_zh: 上九，睽孤，見豕負塗，載鬼一車，先張之弧，後說之弧，匪寇婚媾，往遇雨則吉。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: Isolated through opposition, one sees one's companion as a pig covered with dirt, as a wagon full of devils. First one draws a bow against him, then one lays the bow aside. He is not a robber; he will woo at the right time. As one goes, rain falls; then good fortune comes.

39.judgment_zh: 利西南，不利東北。利見大人，貞吉。
39.judgment_en: Obstruction. The southwest furthers. The northeast does not further. It furthers one to see the great man. Perseverance brings good fortune.
39.image_zh: 山上有水，蹇。君子以反身修德。
39.image_en: Water on the mountain: the image of Obstruction. Thus the superior man turns his attention to himself and molds his character.

lines.line_zh: 初六，往蹇來譽。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Going leads to obstructions, coming meets with praise.

lines.line_zh: 六二，王臣蹇蹇，匪躬之故。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: The king's servant is beset by obstructions, but it is not his own fault.

lines.line_zh: 九三，往蹇來反。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: He goes into obstructions and comes back.

lines.line_zh: 六四，往蹇來連。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: Going leads to obstructions, coming leads to union.

lines.line_zh: 九五，大蹇朋來。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: In the midst of the greatest obstructions, friends come.

lines.line_zh: 上六，往蹇來碩，吉。利見大人。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Going leads to obstructions, coming brings great good fortune. It furthers one to see the great man.

40.judgment_zh: 利西南。無所往，其來復吉。有攸往，夙吉。
40.judgment_en: Deliverance. The southwest furthers. If there is no longer anything where one has to go, return brings good fortune. If there is still something where one has to go, haste brings good fortune.
40.image_zh: 雷雨作，解。君子以赦過宥罪。
40.image_en: Thunder and rain set in: the image of Deliverance. Thus the superior man pardons mistakes and forgives misdeeds.

lines.line_zh: 初六，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Without blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，田獲三狐，得黃矢，貞吉。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: One kills three foxes in the field and receives a yellow arrow. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，負且乘，致寇至，貞吝。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: If a man carries a burden on his back and nonetheless rides in a carriage, he thereby encourages robbers to draw near. Perseverance leads to humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 九四，解而拇，朋至斯孚。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Deliver yourself from your big toe. Then the companion will come, and you can trust him.

lines.line_zh: 六五，君子維有解，吉。有孚于小人。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: If the superior man can be released, there is good fortune. He proves to the inferior man that he is in earnest.

lines.line_zh: 上六，公用射隼于高墉之上，獲之，無不利。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: The prince shoots at a hawk on a high wall. He kills it. Everything serves to further.

41.judgment_zh: 有孚，元吉，無咎，可貞，利有攸往。曷之用，二簋可用享。
41.judgment_en: Decrease combined with sincerity brings about supreme good fortune without blame. One may be persevering in this. It furthers one to undertake something. How is this to be carried out? One may use two small bowls for the sacrifice.
41.image_zh: 山下有澤，損。君子以懲忿窒欲。
41.image_en: At the foot of the mountain, the lake: the image of Decrease. Thus the superior man controls his anger and restrains his instincts.

lines.line_zh: 初九，已事遄往，無咎，酌損之。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Going quickly when one's tasks are finished is without blame. But one must reflect on how much one may decrease others.

lines.line_zh: 九二，利貞，征凶。弗損益之。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: Perseverance furthers. To undertake something brings misfortune. Without decreasing oneself, one is able to bring increase to others.

lines.line_zh: 六三，三人行，則損一人。一人行，則得其友。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: When three people journey together, their number decreases by one. When one man journeys alone, he finds a companion.

lines.line_zh: 六四，損其疾，使遄有喜，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: If a man decreases his faults, it makes the other hasten to rejoice. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，或益之，十朋之龜，弗克違，元吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Someone increases him. Ten pairs of tortoises cannot oppose it. Supreme good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，弗損益之，無咎，貞吉，利有攸往，得臣無家。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: If one increases others without decreasing oneself, there is no blame. Perseverance brings good fortune. It furthers one to undertake something. One obtains servants but no longer has a separate home.

42.judgment_en: Increase. It furthers one to undertake something. It furthers one to cross the great water.
42.image_zh: 風雷，益。君子以見善則遷，有過則改。
42.image_en: Wind and thunder: the image of Increase. Thus the superior man: if he sees good, he imitates it; if he has faults, he rids himself of them.

lines.line_zh: 初九，利用為大作，元吉，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: It is of advantage to perform a great work. Supreme good fortune. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，或益之，十朋之龜，弗克違，永貞吉。王用享于帝，吉。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Someone increases him. Ten pairs of tortoises cannot oppose it. Constant perseverance brings good fortune. The king presents him before God. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，益之用凶事，無咎。有孚中行，告公用圭。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: One is enriched through unfortunate events. No blame, if you are sincere and walk in the middle, and report with a seal to the prince.

lines.line_zh: 六四，中行，告公從。利用為依遷國。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: If you walk in the middle and report to the prince, he will follow. It is favorable to be used in moving the capital.

lines.line_zh: 九五，有孚惠心，勿問元吉。有孚惠我德。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: If you are sincere and kindhearted, ask no questions: supreme good fortune. You will be recognized for your kindness.

lines.line_zh: 上九，莫益之，或擊之，立心勿恆，凶。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: He brings increase to no one. Indeed, someone even strikes him. He does not keep his heart constantly steady. Misfortune.

43.judgment_zh: 揚于王庭，孚號，有厲，告自邑，不利即戎，利有攸往。
43.judgment_en: Break-through. One must resolutely make the matter known at the court of the king. It must be announced truthfully. Danger. It is necessary to notify one's own city. It does not further to resort to arms. It furthers one to undertake something.
43.image_zh: 澤上于天，夬。君子以施祿及下，居德則忌。
43.image_en: The lake has risen up to heaven: the image of Break-through. Thus the superior man dispenses riches downward and refrains from resting on his virtue.

lines.line_zh: 初九，壯于前趾，往不勝為咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the beginning: Mighty in the forward-striding toes. When one goes and is not equal to the task, one makes a mistake.

lines.line_zh: 九二，惕號，莫夜有戎，勿恤。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: A cry of alarm. Arms at evening and at night. Fear nothing.

lines.line_zh: 九三，壯于頄，有凶。君子夬夬獨行，遇雨若濡，有慍，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: To be powerful in the cheekbones brings misfortune. The superior man is firmly resolved. He walks alone and is caught in the rain. He is bespattered, and people murmur against him. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九四，臀無膚，其行次且。牽羊悔亡，聞言不信。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: There is no skin on his thighs, and walking is difficult. If one lets oneself be led like a sheep, remorse disappears. But if these words are heard, they will not be believed.

lines.line_zh: 九五，莧陸夬夬，中行無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: In dealing with weeds, firm resolution is necessary. Walking in the middle remains free of blame.

lines.line_zh: 上六，無號，終有凶。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: No cry. In the end misfortune comes.

44.judgment_en: Coming to Meet. The maiden is powerful. One should not marry such a maiden.
44.image_zh: 天下有風，姤。后以施命誥四方。
44.image_en: Under heaven, wind: the image of Coming to Meet. Thus the prince issues his commands and proclaims them to the four quarters of heaven.

lines.line_zh: 初六，繫于金柅，貞吉。有攸往，見凶。羸豕孚蹢躅。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: It must be checked with a brake of bronze. Perseverance brings good fortune. If one lets it take its course, one experiences misfortune. Even a lean pig has it in him to rage around.

lines.line_zh: 九二，包有魚，無咎，不利賓。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: There is a fish in the tank. No blame. Does not further guests.

lines.line_zh: 九三，臀無膚，其行次且，厲，無大咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: There is no skin on his thighs, and walking is difficult. If one is mindful of the danger, no great mistake is made.

lines.line_zh: 九四，包無魚，起凶。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: No fish in the tank. This leads to misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，以杞包瓜，含章，有隕自天。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: A melon covered with willow leaves. Hidden lines. Then it drops down to one from heaven.

lines.line_zh: 上九，姤其角，吝，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine at the top: He comes to meet with his horns. Humiliation. No blame.

45.judgment_zh: 亨。王假有廟，利見大人，亨，利貞。用大牲吉，利有攸往。
45.judgment_en: Gathering Together. Success. The king approaches his temple. It furthers one to see the great man. This brings success. Perseverance furthers. To make great offerings creates good fortune. It furthers one to undertake something.
45.image_zh: 澤上于地，萃。君子以除戎器，戒不虞。
45.image_en: Over the earth, the lake: the image of Gathering Together. Thus the superior man renews his weapons in order to meet the unforeseen.

lines.line_zh: 初六，有孚不終，乃亂乃萃，若號，一握為笑，勿恤，往無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: If you are sincere, but not to the end, there will sometimes be confusion, sometimes gathering together. If you then cry out, you will afterward be able to laugh. Do not regret it. Go, and you will meet with no blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，引吉，無咎，孚乃利用禴。
lines.line_en: Six in the second place: Letting oneself be drawn brings good fortune and remains without blame. If one is sincere, it is rewarding to bring even a small offering.

lines.line_zh: 六三，萃如嗟如，無攸利，往無咎，小吝。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: Gathering together, as if sighing. Nothing that would further. Going is without blame. Slight humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 九四，大吉，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: Great good fortune. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九五，萃有位，無咎。匪孚，元永貞，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: If in gathering together one has position, this brings no blame. If there are some who are not yet sincerely in the work, they must be won by constant, sincere single-mindedness. Then remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 上六，齎咨涕洟，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Lamenting and sighing, floods of tears. No blame.

46.judgment_zh: 元亨，用見大人，勿恤，南征吉。
46.judgment_en: Pushing Upward has supreme success. One must see the great man. Fear not. Departure toward the south brings good fortune.
46.image_zh: 地中生木，升。君子以順德，積小以高大。
46.image_en: Within the earth, wood grows: the image of Pushing Upward. Thus the superior man of devoted character heaps up small things in order to achieve something high and great.

lines.line_zh: 初六，允升，大吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: Pushing upward that meets with confidence brings great good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，孚乃利用禴，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: If one is sincere, it is rewarding to bring even a small offering. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九三，升虛邑。
lines.line_en: Nine in the third place: One pushes upward into an empty city.

lines.line_zh: 六四，王用亨于岐山，吉，無咎。
lines.line_en: Six in the fourth place: The king offers a sacrifice on Mount Ch'i. Good fortune. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，貞吉，升階。
lines.line_en: Six in the fifth place: Perseverance brings good fortune. One pushes upward by steps.

lines.line_zh: 上六，冥升，利于不息之貞。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: Pushing upward in darkness. It is favorable to be unremittingly persevering.

47.judgment_zh: 亨，貞，大人吉，無咎。有言不信。
47.judgment_en: Oppression. Success. Perseverance. The great man brings good fortune. No blame. When one has something to say, it is not believed.
47.image_zh: 澤無水，困。君子以致命遂志。
47.image_en: There is no water in the lake: the image of Exhaustion. Thus the superior man stakes his life on following his will.

lines.line_zh: 初六，臀困于株木，入于幽谷，三歲不覿。
lines.line_en: Six at the beginning: One's buttocks are oppressed by a stump of a tree. One enters a dark valley. For three years one sees nothing.

lines.line_zh: 九二，困于酒食，朱紱方來，利用亨祀。征凶，無咎。
lines.line_en: Nine in the second place: One is oppressed while at meat and drink. The man with the scarlet knee bands is just coming. It is favorable to offer sacrifice. To set forth brings misfortune. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六三，困于石，據于蒺藜。入于其宮，不見其妻，凶。
lines.line_en: Six in the third place: A man is oppressed by stone, and leans on thorns and thistles. He enters his house and does not see his wife. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，來徐徐，困于金車，吝，有終。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fourth place: He comes very slowly, oppressed in a golden carriage. Humiliation, but the end is reached.

lines.line_zh: 九五，劓刖，困于赤紱，乃徐有說，利用祭祀。
lines.line_en: Nine in the fifth place: His nose and feet are cut off. Oppression at the hands of the man with the scarlet knee bands. Then slowly there comes release. It is favorable to offer sacrifice.

lines.line_zh: 上六，困于葛藟，于臲卼，曰動悔。有悔，征吉。
lines.line_en: Six at the top: He is oppressed by creeping vines. He moves uncertainly and says, 'Movement brings remorse.' If one feels remorse for this and sets forth, good fortune comes.

49.judgment_en: Revolution. On your own day, you are believed. Supreme success, furthering through perseverance. Remorse disappears.
49.image_zh: 澤中有火，革。君子以治歷明時。
49.image_en: Fire in the lake: the image of Revolution. Thus the superior man sets the calendar in order and makes the seasons clear.

lines.line_zh: 初九，鞏用黃牛之革。
lines.line_en: Wrapped in the hide of a yellow cow.

lines.line_zh: 六二，己日乃革之，征吉，無咎。
lines.line_en: When one's own day comes, one may create a revolution. Starting brings good fortune. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九三，征凶，貞厲。革言三就，有孚。
lines.line_en: Starting brings misfortune. Perseverance brings danger. When the talk of revolution has gone around three times, one may commit himself, and people will believe him.

lines.line_zh: 九四，悔亡，有孚改命，吉。
lines.line_en: Remorse disappears. Men believe him. Changing the form of government brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九五，大人虎變，未占有孚。
lines.line_en: The great man changes like a tiger. Even before he questions the oracle, he is believed.

lines.line_zh: 上六，君子豹變，小人革面，征凶，居貞吉。
lines.line_en: The superior man changes like a panther. The inferior man molts in the face. Starting brings misfortune. To remain persevering brings good fortune.

50.judgment_en: The Cauldron. Supreme good fortune. Success.
50.image_zh: 木上有火，鼎。君子以正位凝命。
50.image_en: Fire over wood: the image of the Cauldron. Thus the superior man consolidates his fate by making his position correct.

lines.line_zh: 初六，鼎顛趾，利出否，得妾以其子，無咎。
lines.line_en: A cauldron with legs upturned. Furthers removal of stagnant stuff. One takes a concubine for the sake of her son. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，鼎有實，我仇有疾，不我能即，吉。
lines.line_en: There is food in the cauldron. My comrades are envious, but they cannot harm me. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，鼎耳革，其行塞，雉膏不食，方雨虧悔，終吉。
lines.line_en: The handle of the cauldron is altered. One is impeded in his way of life. The fat of the pheasant is not eaten. Once rain falls, remorse is spent. Good fortune comes in the end.

lines.line_zh: 九四，鼎折足，覆公餗，其形渥，凶。
lines.line_en: The legs of the cauldron are broken. The prince's meal is spilled and his person is soiled. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六五，鼎黃耳金鉉，利貞。
lines.line_en: The cauldron has yellow handles, golden carrying rings. Perseverance furthers.

lines.line_zh: 上九，鼎玉鉉，大吉，無不利。
lines.line_en: The cauldron has rings of jade. Great good fortune. Nothing that does not further.

51.judgment_zh: 亨。震來虩虩，笑言啞啞。震驚百里，不喪匕鬯。
51.judgment_en: Shock brings success. Shock comes—oh, oh! Laughing words—ha, ha! The shock terrifies for a hundred miles, and he does not let fall the sacrificial spoon and chalice.
51.image_zh: 洊雷，震。君子以恐懼修省。
51.image_en: Thunder repeated: the image of Shock. Thus the superior man in fear and trembling sets his life in order and examines himself.

lines.line_zh: 初九，震來虩虩，後笑言啞啞，吉。
lines.line_en: Shock comes—oh, oh! Then follow laughing words—ha, ha! Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六二，震來厲，億喪貝，躋于九陵，勿逐，七日得。
lines.line_en: Shock comes bringing danger. A hundred thousand times you lose your treasures and must climb the nine hills. Do not go in pursuit of them. After seven days you will get them back.

lines.line_zh: 六三，震蘇蘇，震行無眚。
lines.line_en: Shock is spent. If one acts on the shock, one remains free of misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，震遂泥。
lines.line_en: Shock is mired.

lines.line_zh: 六五，震往來厲，億無喪，有事。
lines.line_en: Shock goes hither and thither. Danger. However, nothing is lost. Yet there are things to be done.

lines.line_zh: 上六，震索索，視矍矍，征凶。震不于其躬，于其鄰，無咎。婚媾有言。
lines.line_en: Shock brings ruin and terrified gazing around. Going ahead brings misfortune. If it has not yet touched one's own body but has touched one's neighbor, there is no blame. One's comrades have something to talk about.

52.judgment_zh: 艮其背，不獲其身，行其庭，不見其人，無咎。
52.judgment_en: Keeping Still. Keeping his back still so that he no longer feels his body. He goes into his courtyard and does not see his people. No blame.
52.image_zh: 兼山，艮。君子以思不出其位。
52.image_en: Mountains standing close together: the image of Keeping Still. Thus the superior man does not permit his thoughts to go beyond his situation.

lines.line_zh: 初六，艮其趾，無咎，利永貞。
lines.line_en: Keeping his toes still. No blame. Constant perseverance furthers.

lines.line_zh: 六二，艮其腓，不拯其隨，其心不快。
lines.line_en: Keeping his calves still. He cannot rescue him whom he follows. His heart is not glad.

lines.line_zh: 九三，艮其限，列其夤，厲薰心。
lines.line_en: Keeping his hips still. Making his sacrum stiff. Dangerous. The heart suffocates.

lines.line_zh: 六四，艮其身，無咎。
lines.line_en: Keeping his trunk still. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六五，艮其輔，言有序，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Keeping his jaws still. The words have order. Remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 上九，敦艮，吉。
lines.line_en: Noble-hearted keeping still. Good fortune.

53.judgment_en: Development. The maiden is given in marriage. Good fortune. Perseverance furthers.
53.image_zh: 山上有木，漸。君子以居賢德善俗。
53.image_en: On the mountain, a tree: the image of Development. Thus the superior man abides in dignity and virtue, in order to improve the customs.

lines.line_zh: 初六，鴻漸于干，小子厲，有言，無咎。
lines.line_en: The wild goose gradually draws near the shore. The young son is in danger. There is talk. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，鴻漸于磐，飲食衎衎，吉。
lines.line_en: The wild goose gradually draws near the cliff. Eating and drinking in peace and concord. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九三，鴻漸于陸，夫征不復，婦孕不育，凶。利禦寇。
lines.line_en: The wild goose gradually draws near the plateau. The husband goes forth and does not return. The wife carries a child but does not bring it forth. Misfortune. It is favorable to ward off robbers.

lines.line_zh: 六四，鴻漸于木，或得其桷，無咎。
lines.line_en: The wild goose gradually draws near the tree. Perhaps it will find a flat bough. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九五，鴻漸于陵，婦三歲不孕，終莫之勝，吉。
lines.line_en: The wild goose gradually draws near the summit. For three years the wife has no child. In the end nothing can hinder her. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，鴻漸于陸，其羽可用為儀，吉。
lines.line_en: The wild goose gradually draws near the clouds heights. Its feathers can be used for the sacred dance. Good fortune.

54.judgment_en: The Marrying Maiden. Undertakings bring misfortune. Nothing that would further.
54.image_zh: 澤上有雷，歸妹。君子以永終知敝。
54.image_en: Thunder over the lake: the image of the Marrying Maiden. Thus the superior man understands the transitory in the light of the eternity of the end.

lines.line_zh: 初九，歸妹以娣，跛能履，征吉。
lines.line_en: The marrying maiden as a concubine. A lame man who is able to tread. Undertakings bring good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，眇能視，利幽人之貞。
lines.line_en: A one-eyed man who is able to see. The perseverance of a solitary man furthers.

lines.line_zh: 六三，歸妹以須，反歸以娣。
lines.line_en: The marrying maiden as a slave. She marries as a concubine.

lines.line_zh: 九四，歸妹愆期，遲歸有時。
lines.line_en: The marrying maiden draws out the allotted time. A late marriage comes in due course.

lines.line_zh: 六五，帝乙歸妹，其君之袂，不如其娣之袂良。月幾望，吉。
lines.line_en: The sovereign I gives his daughter in marriage. The embroidered garments of the princess were not as gorgeous as those of the serving maid. The moon that is nearly full brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，女承筐無實，士刲羊無血，無攸利。
lines.line_en: The woman holds the basket, but there are no fruits in it. The man stabs the sheep, but no blood flows from it. Nothing that serves to further.

55.judgment_en: Abundance has success. The king attains abundance. Be not sad. Be like the sun at midday.
55.image_zh: 雷電皆至，豐。君子以折獄致刑。
55.image_en: Both thunder and lightning come: the image of Abundance. Thus the superior man decides lawsuits and carries out punishments.

lines.line_zh: 初九，遇其配主，雖旬無咎，往有尚。
lines.line_en: When a man meets his destined ruler, they can be together ten days, and it is not a mistake. Going meets with recognition.

lines.line_zh: 六二，豐其蔀，日中見斗，往得疑疾，有孚發若，吉。
lines.line_en: The curtain is of such fullness that the polestars can be seen at noon. Through going one meets with mistrust and hate. If one rouses him through truth, good fortune comes.

lines.line_zh: 九三，豐其沛，日中見昧，折其右肱，無咎。
lines.line_en: The underbrush is of such richness that the small stars can be seen at noon. He breaks his right arm. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九四，豐其蔀，日中見斗，遇其夷主，吉。
lines.line_en: The curtain is of such fullness that the polestars can be seen at noon. He meets his ruler, who is of like kind. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六五，來章，有慶譽，吉。
lines.line_en: He brings brilliant men to the court. There is blessing and praise. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上六，豐其屋，蔀其家，窺其戶，闃其無人，三歲不覿，凶。
lines.line_en: His house is in a state of abundance. He screens off his family. He peers through the gate and no longer perceives anyone. For three years he sees nothing. Misfortune.

56.judgment_en: The Wanderer. Success through smallness. Perseverance brings good fortune to the wanderer.
56.image_zh: 山上有火，旅。君子以明慎用刑而不留獄。
56.image_en: Fire on the mountain: the image of the Wanderer. Thus the superior man is clear-minded and cautious in imposing penalties, and does not protract lawsuits.

lines.line_zh: 初六，旅瑣瑣，斯其所取災。
lines.line_en: If the wanderer busies himself with trivial things, he draws down misfortune upon himself.

lines.line_zh: 六二，旅即次，懷其資，得童僕貞。
lines.line_en: The wanderer comes to an inn. He has money in his possession. He wins the steadfastness of a young servant.

lines.line_zh: 九三，旅焚其次，喪其童僕，貞厲。
lines.line_en: The wanderer's inn burns down. He loses the steadfastness of his young servant. Danger.

lines.line_zh: 九四，旅于處，得其資斧，我心不快。
lines.line_en: The wanderer rests in a shelter. He obtains his property and an ax. My heart is not glad.

lines.line_zh: 六五，射雉一矢亡，終以譽命。
lines.line_en: He shoots a pheasant. It drops with the first arrow. In the end this brings him praise and office.

lines.line_zh: 上九，鳥焚其巢，旅人先笑後號啕。喪牛于易，凶。
lines.line_en: The bird's nest burns up. The wanderer laughs at first, then must lament and weep. Through carelessness he loses his cow. Misfortune.

57.judgment_zh: 小亨，利有攸往，利見大人。
57.judgment_en: The Gentle. Success through what is small. It furthers one to have somewhere to go. It furthers one to see the great man.
57.image_zh: 隨風，巽。君子以申命行事。
57.image_en: Winds following one upon the other: the image of the Gentle. Thus the superior man spreads his commands abroad and carries his undertakings to completion.

lines.line_zh: 初六，進退，利武人之貞。
lines.line_en: In advancing and in retreating, the perseverance of a warrior furthers.

lines.line_zh: 九二，巽在床下，用史巫紛若，吉無咎。
lines.line_en: Penetration under the bed. Priests and magicians are used in great number. Good fortune. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九三，頻巽，吝。
lines.line_en: Repeated penetration. Humiliation.

lines.line_zh: 六四，悔亡，田獲三品。
lines.line_en: Remorse vanishes. In the hunt three kinds of game are caught.

lines.line_zh: 九五，貞吉悔亡，無不利。無初有終，先庚三日，後庚三日，吉。
lines.line_en: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse vanishes. Nothing that does not further. No beginning, but an end. Before the change, three days. After the change, three days. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，巽在床下，喪其資斧，貞凶。
lines.line_en: Penetration under the bed. He loses his property and his ax. Perseverance brings misfortune.

58.judgment_en: The Joyous. Success. Perseverance is favorable.
58.image_zh: 麗澤，兌。君子以朋友講習。
58.image_en: Lakes resting one on the other: the image of the Joyous. Thus the superior man joins with his friends for discussion and practice.

lines.line_zh: 初九，和兌，吉。
lines.line_en: Contented joyousness. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，孚兌，吉，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Sincere joyousness. Good fortune. Remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 六三，來兌，凶。
lines.line_en: Coming joyousness. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，商兌未寧，介疾有喜。
lines.line_en: Joyousness that is weighed is not at peace. After ridding himself of his mistakes, a man has joy.

lines.line_zh: 九五，孚于剝，有厲。
lines.line_en: Sincerity toward disintegrating influences is dangerous.

lines.line_zh: 上六，引兌。
lines.line_en: Seductive joyousness.

59.judgment_zh: 亨。王假有廟，利涉大川，利貞。
59.judgment_en: Dispersion. Success. The king approaches his temple. It furthers one to cross the great water. Perseverance furthers.
59.image_zh: 風行水上，渙。先王以享于帝立廟。
59.image_en: Wind blowing over water: the image of Dispersion. Thus the ancient kings made offerings to God and built temples.

lines.line_zh: 初六，用拯馬壯，吉。
lines.line_en: He brings help with the strength of a horse. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 九二，渙奔其机，悔亡。
lines.line_en: In the midst of dispersion, he hurries to his support. Remorse disappears.

lines.line_zh: 六三，渙其躬，無悔。
lines.line_en: He disperses his self. No remorse.

lines.line_zh: 六四，渙其群，元吉。渙有丘，匪夷所思。
lines.line_en: He disperses his group. Supreme good fortune. Dispersion leads in turn to accumulation. This is something that ordinary men do not think of.

lines.line_zh: 九五，渙汗其大號，渙王居，無咎。
lines.line_en: His loud cries are as dissolving as sweat. Dispersion. A king abides without blame.

lines.line_zh: 上九，渙其血，去逖出，無咎。
lines.line_en: He disperses his blood. Departing, keeping at a distance, going out, is without blame.

60.judgment_en: Limitation. Success. Galling limitation must not be persevered in.
60.image_zh: 澤上有水，節。君子以制數度，議德行。
60.image_en: Water over lake: the image of Limitation. Thus the superior man creates number and measure, and examines the nature of virtue and correct conduct.

lines.line_zh: 初九，不出戶庭，無咎。
lines.line_en: Not going out of the door and courtyard is without blame.

lines.line_zh: 九二，不出門庭，凶。
lines.line_en: Not going out of the gate and courtyard brings misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，不節若，則嗟若，無咎。
lines.line_en: He who knows no limitation will have cause to lament. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六四，安節，亨。
lines.line_en: Contented limitation. Success.

lines.line_zh: 九五，甘節，吉，往有尚。
lines.line_en: Sweet limitation brings good fortune. Going brings esteem.

lines.line_zh: 上六，苦節，貞凶，悔亡。
lines.line_en: Galling limitation. Perseverance brings misfortune. Remorse disappears.

61.judgment_en: Inner Truth. Pigs and fishes. Good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water. Perseverance furthers.
61.image_zh: 澤上有風，中孚。君子以議獄緩死。
61.image_en: Wind over lake: the image of Inner Truth. Thus the superior man discusses criminal cases in order to delay executions.

lines.line_zh: 初九，虞吉，有他不燕。
lines.line_en: Being prepared brings good fortune. If there are secret designs, it is disquieting.

lines.line_zh: 九二，鳴鶴在陰，其子和之，我有好爵，吾與爾靡之。
lines.line_en: A crane calling in the shade. Its young answers it. I have a good goblet. I will share it with you.

lines.line_zh: 六三，得敵，或鼓或罷，或泣或歌。
lines.line_en: He finds a comrade. Now he beats the drum, now he stops. Now he weeps, now he sings.

lines.line_zh: 六四，月幾望，馬匹亡，無咎。
lines.line_en: The moon is nearly full. The team horse goes astray. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九五，有孚攣如，無咎。
lines.line_en: He possesses truth, which links together. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 上九，翰音登于天，貞凶。
lines.line_en: Cockcrow penetrating to heaven. Perseverance brings misfortune.

62.judgment_zh: 亨，利貞，可小事，不可大事。飛鳥遺之音，不宜上，宜下，大吉。
62.judgment_en: Preponderance of the Small. Success. Perseverance furthers. Small things may be done; great things should not be done. The flying bird brings the message: It is not well to strive upward, it is well to remain below. Great good fortune.
62.image_zh: 山上有雷，小過。君子以行過乎恭，喪過乎哀，用過乎儉。
62.image_en: Thunder on the mountain: the image of Preponderance of the Small. Thus in his conduct the superior man gives preponderance to reverence. In bereavement he gives preponderance to grief. In his expenditures he gives preponderance to thrift.

lines.line_zh: 初六，飛鳥以凶。
lines.line_en: The bird meets with misfortune through flying.

lines.line_zh: 六二，過其祖，遇其妣，不及其君，遇其臣，無咎。
lines.line_en: She passes by her ancestor and meets her ancestress. He does not reach his prince and meets the official. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 九三，弗過防之，從或戕之，凶。
lines.line_en: If one is not extremely careful, somebody may come from behind and strike him. Misfortune.

lines.line_zh: 九四，無咎，弗過遇之。往厲必戒，勿用永貞。
lines.line_en: No blame. He meets him without passing by. Going brings danger. One must be on guard. Do not act. Be constantly persevering.

lines.line_zh: 六五，密雲不雨，自我西郊，公弋取彼在穴。
lines.line_en: Dense clouds, no rain from our western territory. The prince shoots and hits him who is in the cave.

lines.line_zh: 上六，弗遇過之，飛鳥離之，凶，是謂災眚。
lines.line_en: He passes him by, not meeting him. The flying bird leaves him. Misfortune. This means bad luck and injury.

63.judgment_en: After Completion. Success in small matters. Perseverance furthers. At the beginning good fortune, at the end disorder.
63.image_zh: 水在火上，既濟。君子以思患而豫防之。
63.image_en: Water over fire: the image of the state of After Completion. Thus the superior man takes thought of misfortune and arms himself against it in advance.

lines.line_zh: 初九，曳其輪，濡其尾，無咎。
lines.line_en: He brakes his wheels. He gets his tail in the water. No blame.

lines.line_zh: 六二，婦喪其茀，勿逐，七日得。
lines.line_en: The woman loses the curtain of her carriage. Do not run after it; on the seventh day you will get it.

lines.line_zh: 九三，高宗伐鬼方，三年克之，小人勿用。
lines.line_en: The Illustrious Ancestor subjugates the devil's country. After three years he conquers it. Inferior people should not be employed.

lines.line_zh: 六四，繻有衣袽，終日戒。
lines.line_en: The finest clothes turn to rags. Be careful all day long.

lines.line_zh: 九五，東鄰殺牛，不如西鄰之禴祭，實受其福。
lines.line_en: The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox does not attain as much real happiness as the neighbor in the west with his small offering.

lines.line_zh: 上六，濡其首，厲。
lines.line_en: He gets his head in the water. Danger.

64.judgment_zh: 亨，小狐汔濟，濡其尾，無攸利。
64.judgment_en: Before Completion. Success. But if the little fox, after nearly completing the crossing, gets his tail in the water, there is nothing that would further.
64.image_zh: 火在水上，未濟。君子以慎辨物居方。
64.image_en: Fire over water: the image of the condition before transition. Thus the superior man is careful in the differentiation of things, so that each finds its place.

lines.line_zh: 初六，濡其尾，吝。
lines.line_en: He gets his tail in the water. Humiliating.

lines.line_zh: 九二，曳其輪，貞吉。
lines.line_en: He brakes his wheels. Perseverance brings good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 六三，未濟，征凶，利涉大川。
lines.line_en: Before completion, attack brings misfortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.

lines.line_zh: 九四，貞吉悔亡，震用伐鬼方，三年有賞于大國。
lines.line_en: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. Shock, in order to punish the devil's country. For three years, great realms are awarded.

lines.line_zh: 六五，貞吉，無悔，君子之光，有孚，吉。
lines.line_en: Perseverance brings good fortune. No remorse. The light of the superior man is true. Good fortune.

lines.line_zh: 上九，有孚于飲酒，無咎，濡其首，有孚失是。
lines.line_en: There is drinking of wine in genuine confidence. No blame. But if one wets his head, he loses it, in truth.
